recipesJson.name: Soho Time (SNV New Skool Tribeca type)
recipesJson.author: Juicefairy
recipesJson.description:
Tribeca was one of my favorite mixes from Halo ecigs and even after I was mixing I would treat myself to a bottle every now and then. This isn't a 1 for 1 of Tribeca but it is very reminiscent of it without being overly sweet like the original was.
Can it really be a Tobacco S&V YES!! Yesss it can!!! I know this is just two ingredients I know Meringue looks high as hell and Soho looks like too much. I know it's hard to believe, but try it! It works and was my ADV for about 3 months. Not only was it my ADV but it's still what I vape when I cant taste anything else. This is a recipe is not mine originally a good friend shared the correct % with me after I tried his juice but he doesn't post on forums and does not want his name on the recipe.  My friend is in groups and knows I share this forward and I wanted to share it here too!

reviews.text: I'm on a real Soho kick lately, and this recipe, simple as it is, lets Soho stand in all its glory.  The percentages seem crazy, but this just works.  Solid proof that sometimes the best way to do the most is to do less.
I love this stuff! Great way to show how good Soho is...
This so simple but so damn good great recipe.

I have never tried the Tribecca flavour as I live in South Africa but I Love this recipe.  It is currently my ADV and it's so easy to make and being a SNV is an added bonus!  Thank you so much Juicefairy, you rock! :)

Not bad at all but I had to add some vanilla to it. Was just a tad to plain for my liking but I have also been using in a pod so that can be the reason. Tastes awesome with some vanilla ice cream LB and vbic cap. 1% and 2% in that order.
This is currently my favorite way to vape Soho. Sometimes simple is the best. Well done!

Well played sir.  I haven't SFTested soho yet, and this is awfully close to that delicious Tribecca sultriness.  I found a Tribecca clone that is very close, and I think this will complete it...though with how simple this mix is, I may just run with this one!  Thank you, and again, well done!
